intro.description: In this tutorial, we'll run a model!

item.title: Import Example Projects
item.description: If you haven't already loaded the example projects, you'll need to do that first.

item.title: Select Model
item.description: Select a model to execute. If you've imported the example projects you can use the Epidemic Model. Or if you've created your own model, just select that model class instead.

item.title: Start the model
item.description: Now we can start the model in one of three ways. •Right-click and select "Execute" from the menu. •Select the "Execute" from the toolbar. •Select "Execute" from the "Control" menu. If you've imported the example projects and want to run the Epidmic model, you can just Click to Perform and we'll do it for you!!

item.title: Explore Model Controls
item.description: You can pause, unpause, step, restart, and stop the model. Try that now.

item.title: Explore Chart View
item.description: Take a look at the Chart View. From here, you can easily change the type of the chart and whether the text is displayed or not. Experiment with different selections.

item.title: Select Chart Items
item.description: If you look at the Chart Customizer (Click to Perform) you'll see that it provides a very quick way to select different chart series to view. Select the chart for the running model and note that the available chart items are updated. Each row represents a statistic that has been defined for the model, and each column represents a measure (i.e. Average or Sum) that is automatically being tracked for that statistic. No need to setup a complex chart series! Click some chart items to see how this works. Note that you can clear all of the current selection by clicking the gray "X" box.

item.title: Find out more about the model
item.description: If the model developer has provided an "About[model].html" file in a "res" directory, you;ll be able to find out more about the model by looking at the "About Model" view.

item.title: Working with Agent Properties
item.description: Select an agent in the Graphic View. The Agent will be selected in the properties view. You can even change the value of an agent. Try changin an agent's status form say "susceptible" to "exposed". You'll see the agent's color update immediatly in the Graphic View.

item.title: Working with Model Parameters
item.description: You can change model parameters in the same way. To select a model as a whole, click on the chart view or in the open area of the model manager.

item.title: View Agent Navigator
item.description: The Agent Navigator allows you to view a tree view of agent contents. You can open up scapes (collections of agents) and view properties for those agents. If you select Agents in the tree view, they'll be selected in the graphics views; it works the other way around as well.
